title: 104_s892
content: The Act titled "Protection of Children From Computer Pornography Act of 1995" addresses the transmission of indecent material to minors via computer. The Act "Protection of Children From Computer Pornography Act of 1995" addresses the transmission of indecent material to minors via computer, amending Section 1464 of title 18, United States Code to include the utterance of indecent or profane language by radio communication and the transmission of indecent material to minors from remote computer facilities or electronic services. The Act "Protection of Children From Computer Pornography Act of 1995" defines terms related to computer services and electronic communications, including the provision of computer storage or processing services and the transmission of electronic communications between computers. The Act "Protection of Children From Computer Pornography Act of 1995" defines terms related to computer services, including electronic bulletin board services that provide digital images or online discussion groups. It also covers the transmission of material by operators or providers who knowingly transmit such content. The Act "Protection of Children From Computer Pornography Act of 1995" prohibits the transmission of indecent material to minors from remote computer facilities, electronic communications services, or electronic bulletin boards. Offenders can face fines, imprisonment up to 5 years, or both. Additionally, operators or providers allowing access to transmit indecent material to minors can also be held liable. The Act "Protection of Children From Computer Pornography Act of 1995" prohibits the transmission of indecent material to minors from remote computer facilities, electronic communications services, or electronic bulletin boards. Offenders can face fines, imprisonment up to 5 years, or both. Additionally, operators or providers allowing access to transmit indecent material to minors can also be held liable. The fine for permitting such transmission is up to $10,000, imprisonment up to 2 years, or both. The Act prohibits the transmission of indecent material to minors from remote computer facilities or electronic communications services. Offenders can face fines, imprisonment up to 5 years, or both.
